mng: saddle crupper (harness strap on horse's back)

exm.mng: helping tyrant Zhòu 紂|纣 in his oppression (idiom); to take the side of the evil-doer, giving succor to the enemy
King Wu of Zhou 周武王[Zhou1 Wu3 wang2] overthrows tyrant Zhou of Shang 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2]
King Zhou of Shang (11th century BC), notorious as a cruel tyrant
Zhou Xin (c. 11th century BC), last emperor of the of Shang Dynasty
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom), fig. to take the side of the evildoer, giving succor to the enemy
